member.name: IDiscRecorder2.AcquireExclusiveAccess
member.summary: Acquires exclusive access to the device.
member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to gain exclusive access to the volume whether the file system volume can or cannot be dismounted. If VARIANT_FALSE, this method gains exclusive access only when there is no file system mounted on the volume.

String that contains the friendly name of the client application requesting exclusive access. Cannot be NULL or a zero-length string. The string must conform to the restrictions for the IOCTL_CDROM_EXCLUSIVE_ACCESS control code found in the DDK.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

The device is currently being used by another application.
Value: 0x80070005

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to fail.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.CloseTray
member.summary: Closes the media tray.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.DisableMcn
member.summary: Disables Media Change Notification (MCN) for the device.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.get_ActiveDiscRecorder
member.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier used to initialize the disc device.
member.param: Unique identifier for the device. This is the identifier you specified when calling .

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.get_CurrentFeaturePages
member.summary: Retrieves the list of feature pages of the device that are marked as current.
member.param: List of supported feature pages that are marked as current for the device. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_I4. The lVal member of the variant contains the feature page type. For possible values, see the enumeration.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

The drive does not support the GET CONFIGURATION command.
Value: 0xC0AA020C

The feature page requested is not supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020A

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The feature page requested is supported, but is not marked as current.
Value: 0xC0AA020B

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.get_DeviceCanLoadMedia
member.summary: Determines if the device can eject and subsequently reload media.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the device can eject and subsequently reload media. If VARIANT_FALSE, loading media must be done manually.
param.div: Note For slim drives or laptop drives, which utilize a manual tray-loading mechanism, this parameter can indicate an incorrect value of VARIANT_TRUE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.summary: Retrieves the name of the client application that has exclusive access to the device.
member.param: String that contains the name of the client application that has exclusive access to the device.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.get_LegacyDeviceNumber
member.summary: Retrieves the legacy device number for a CD or DVD device.

param.name: legacyDeviceNumber
param.para: Zero-based index number of the device, based on the order the device was installed on the computer.
This value can change during PNP activity when devices are added or removed from the computer, or across boot sessions and should not be considered a unique identifier for the device.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.summary: Retrieves the product ID of the device.
member.param: String that contains the product ID of the device.

Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.get_SupportedFeaturePages
member.summary: Retrieves the list of features that the device supports.
member.param: List of features that the device supports. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_I4. The lVal member of the variant contains the feature page type value. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

The drive does not support the GET CONFIGURATION command.
Value: 0xC0AA020C

The feature page requested is not supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020A

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The feature page requested is supported, but is not marked as current.
Value: 0xC0AA020B

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.summary: Retrieves a list of drive letters and NTFS mount points for the device.
member.param: List of drive letters and NTFS mount points for the device. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_BSTR. The bstrVal member of the variant contains the path.

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.InitializeDiscRecorder
member.summary: Associates the object with the specified disc device.
member.param: String that contains the unique identifier for the device.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057
The value in cchDest is either 0 or larger than STRSAFE_MAX_CCH.

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2.ReleaseExclusiveAccess
member.summary: Releases exclusive access to the device.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

summary.para: This interface represents a physical device. You use this interface to retrieve information about a CD and DVD device installed on the computer and to perform operations such as closing the tray or eject the media.
To create an instance of this interface, call the CoCreateInstance function. Use__uuidof(MsftDiscRecorder2) for the class identifier and __uuidof(IDiscRecorder2) for the interface identifier.
